titles: The mystery of dreames, historically discoursed; or A treatise; wherein is clearly discovered, the secret yet certain good or evil, the inconsidered and yet assured truth or falsity, virtue or vanity, misery or mercy, of mens differing dreames. Their distinguishing characters: the divers cases, causes, concomitants, consequences, concerning mens inmost thoughts while asleep. With severall considerable questions, objections, and answers contained therein: and other profitable truths appertaining thereunto. Are from pertinent texts plainly and fully unfolded. / By Philip Goodwin preacher of the Gospel at Watford in Hartfordshire.
author: Goodwin, Philip, d. 1699.
publisher: Printed by A.M. for Francis Tyton at the Three Daggers near St Dunstans Church in Fleet-street.,
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Febr."; the 8 in the imprint has been crossed out and replaced with a "7".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Dreams --  Religious aspects --  Early works to 1800.
